Name: Luc Nederhof
universityAnswer: Queensland University of Technology, Bacherlors of Engineering (Honours), 3rd year
whyStudyAnswer: I have been doing robotics since I was in year 9 of High School. I have always been passionate about high school robotics program and always had a great affinity towards STEM subjects. I chose engineering as it is a very employable job that aligned with my interests, and allows me to go in many different and versatile directions even when I graduate.
dreamJobAnswer: I just want to do something cool, probably involving building robots.
whyRobogalsAnswer: I joined Robogals because I believe I have a lot of value to offer this organisation. I also think that diversity within STEM degrees is sorely lacking, and I want to encourage anyone and everyone with a passion for technically involved jobs to pursue them as more varied teams with more varied perspectives always leads to better solutions.
appliedStemAnswer: Robots. They bring together countless different disciplines and skills into a final product that adds value to the world.
funFactsAnswer: I am fully fluent in Dutch and lived there untill the end of primary school! I teach a high school robotics program, And I'm projects manager for the QUT robotics club.
